result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Lamar McDuffie

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin Lamar McDuffie appeared by video, in custody.  
Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Justin Lamar McDuffie.  
Attorney Stephan Nolten for  Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing.
Defendant produced from Stanley  Correctional Institution.
Court is in trial. Defense do not consent to a spin court and request an adjournment.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Defense Counsel in trial in a different court and unavailable, 
Per email defendant has been transferred to Stanley Correctional Institution.  
New date selected with the parties via email. Court ordered case adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed. Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed. Plea Quesitonnaire/ Waiver of Rights / Addendum

Attorney Ashley Fard in court.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Court unable to hear case on today's date, May 18th, 2022, due to court congestion. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court.  Defendant Justin Lamar McDuffie in custody appearance waived.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing.  Defense received a new offer from the state she is requesting  an adjournment to review the offer with her client.  The court grants defense request.  The matter is adjourned back to Branch 45 in person.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court va zoom, defendant Justin Lamar McDuffie not in court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Jessica Bellows.  Case is adjourned in Br 45 for in person plea and sentencing.  mn  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No appearance by defense counsel.  Case is rescheduled to 3/18/22 at 8:30 for scheduling in br 45.   mn

Defendant Justin Lamar McDuffie in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Justin Lamar McDuffie in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Justin Lamar McDuffie appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Justino Rodriguez, Milwaukee Police Department Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Court ordered no contact with Indiana M. & PO Justino Rodriguez (while not in law enforcement capcity)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Justin Lamar McDuffie in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Justin Lamar McDuffie in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Justin Lamar McDuffie appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant hemay qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if hemeets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
